document.masterDocTitle: Synopsis of the Neotropical Dissomphalus (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Synopsis of the Neotropical Dissomphalus (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Evans, H. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Evans, H. E. (1964) A synopsis of the American Bethylidae (Hymenoptera, Aculeata). Bulletin of the Museum of Comparative Zoology, 132, 1 - 222.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dissomphalus plaumanni Evans 1964: 47
, 52, 58–59,
Gordh & Moczar 1990: 225
,
Azevedo 1999c: 939–941
.

subSubSection.paragraph: This is one of the most widespread species through the Neotropical region ( Azevedo, 1999c ), and now it is recorded for the first time to Espírito Santo .

Material examined. —
COSTA RICA , 2 males ,
Puntarenas
, vic. Alta San Luis ,
1100m
, forest, 10.28°N 84.80°W , 1–14.XIII.1997, Malaise trap , L. Lapierre col. ( LACM )
;
